summary.p: 147 fol.; Writing surface: parchment; Shelfmark: E. H. 29; Text: Q 1:1-Q 2:266; 7 lines per page; Dimensions: 183 x 123 mm; Script style: kūfī; Estimated date of production: 2nd (8th) to 3rd (9th) centuries [according to Karatay].

This entry is based on the catalogue of Fehmi E. Karatay (1888-1968). Currently we do not have access to the images. With exceptions, the catalogue does not contain precise information on the distribution of the text throughout the pages. For this reason, only fol. 1 is given.

Karatay (1962) describes the manuscripts as follows, p. 14: "36 E. H. 29 Kur’an’dan bir parça Parşömen. 123mm boy ve 183mm eninde cönk biciminde 147 yaprak. Sahifede II-III. (VIII-IX) asır kûfîsiyle 140mm uzunl.[uğunda] 7 satır. Sonunda yaldızla yapılmış geçmeli iki levha. Kahve rengi deri cilt. Bu ciltte Kur’an’ın başından Baḳara (2) suresinin 266. ayetinin sonuna kadar olup لعلكم تتفكرون kelimesiyle bitiyor."

This can be translated as follows: "36 E. H. 29 A part of the Qurʾān Parchment. 147 junk shaped leaves of 123 mm height and 183 mm width. The text area written in Kufic script of 2nd-3rd(8th-9th) centuries [contains] 7 lines measuring 140 mm. There are two interlaced borders made with gilding at the end. Brown leather binding. This fragment is from the beginning of the Qurʾān until the end of Q 2:266 (Sūra al-Baqara), it ends with the words لعلكم تتفكرون."
